required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-human, Multicenter, Open-label, Phase 1 Study in Patients With Advanced and/or Refractory Solid Malignancies to Evaluate the Safety of Intravenously Administered ATOR-1015

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate the safety and tolerability of ATOR-1015 when administered as repeated intravenous infusions to patients with advanced and/or refractory solid malignancies.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability: Adverse events (AEs) assessed by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until 28 days after last dose
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-related AEs assessed by CTCAE v5.0

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs include blood pressure, pulse rate, oxygen saturation and body temperature. Clinically significant abnormal findings will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Physical examination will as a minimum include examination of mouth, throat, lymph nodes, respiratory, cardiovascular system, abdomen, extremities, neurological system and skin. Clinically significant abnormal findings will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Clinically significant abnormal ECG findings will be reported as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability: Clinical laboratory tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory tests include clinical chemistry, hematology, coagulation, hormones and urinalysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum observed serum concentration of ATOR-1015 (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area under the ATOR-1015 serum concentration-time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity: Anti-drug antibody (ADA) titer in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of antibodies to ATOR-1015 will be evaluated

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical efficacy: Anti-tumor activity assessed by response evaluation criteria in solid tumors for immune-based therapeutics (iRECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study until end of study (28-56 days after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Computed tomography (CT) scans of tumors will be evaluated according to iRECIST

arm_group.description: ATOR-1015 administered by intravenous infusions every 2 weeks until confirmed progressive disease, unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of consent.

intervention.description: Bispecific human monoclonal antibody targeting cytotoxic T-lymphocyte associated protein 4 (CTLA-4) and OX40 (also known as CD134)

criteria.textblock:
Major Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of advanced and/or refractory solid malignancy
- Eastern Cooperation Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
- Life expectancy of at least 3 months
Major Exclusion Criteria:
- Organ transplant recipient
- Active autoimmune disorder
- Other malignancy

overall_official.affiliation: Centrum för Kliniska Cancerstudier (CKC), Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset

facility.name: Phase 1 Unit, Department of Oncology, Rigshospitalet
